0.title: I don't have time for people venting: Kareena on not using Twitter
0.article_body: Speaking about not being a Twitter user, actress Kareena Kapoor stated that she feels like the social media platform is for people who "just want to keep venting". She further said that celebrities are trolled on Twitter every other day amid cancel culture. "That's why I'm not on Twitter...I don't have time for that," the actress stated.

1.title: CISF holds Tiranga bike rally in Hyderabad
1.article_body: Ahead of Independence Day, Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) on Thursday held a Tiranga bike rally in Hyderabad. National Flags were also distributed among commuters to support the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "All CISF personnel inclusive of all ranks carried out a bike rally holding Tricolours in their hands in city side area of Hyderabad airport," an official statement said.

2.title: US Justice Dept seeks to unseal search warrant of Trump’s home
2.article_body: The US Justice Department is asking a court to unseal the warrant that let FBI agents search ex-President Donald Trump's Florida home. If granted, the documents would be available to the public. Monday's FBI search of Trump's Mar-a-Lago property is believed to be connected to an investigation into whether he removed classified records and sensitive material from the White House.

3.title: 6 killed after Congress MLA's son-in-law rams SUV into bike, rickshaw in Gujarat
3.article_body: At least six persons, including three women, died in an accident that took place between a car, bike and an auto-rickshaw on Thursday at around 7 pm in Gujarat's Anand, police said. Khetan Padhiyar, the son-in-law of Congress MLA Punambhai Madhabhai Parmar from Sojitra, allegedly rammed his SUV into the bike and auto-rickshaw. Khetan has been arrested, police added.

4.title: 6-yr-old girl kidnapped from Pune bus depot, rescued within 12 hrs
4.article_body: Pune police have rescued a six-year-old girl who was kidnapped from the Swargate bus depot within 12 hours. Two women were arrested for allegedly abducting the girl due to an ongoing financial dispute between their family and the girl's family, a senior police inspector said. "Our team rescued the girl from Solapur on Wednesday evening," the senior police inspector added.

5.title: Man sentenced to 20 yrs in jail for sexually assaulting minor in Hyd
5.article_body: A Hyderabad court on Thursday sentenced a man to 20 years of imprisonment for sexually assaulting an eight-year-old girl in 2015. According to reports, the victim's parents worked at a college and lived on campus with their two children. On August 26, when the girl's parents left the room, the accused reportedly took her to nearby bushes and assaulted her.

6.title: Went to Sonam's bully, felt it'd be like SRK in Josh; got socked in eye: Arjun
6.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said he got "black eye" after he went to actress Sonam Kapoor's bully in school. Arjun said he asked the bully how can he talk to Sonam in a certain way, adding that he imagined it would be like Shah Rukh Khan in 'Josh' where two gangs fight, but he just got "socked in the eye".

7.title: Don't reveal our military tactics against Russia: Zelenskyy to officials
7.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has told officials to stop talking to journalists about the country's military tactics against Russia, saying such remarks are "frankly irresponsible". "War is definitely not the time for vanity and loud statements. The fewer details you divulge about our defence plans, the better it will be for the implementation of those defence plans," Zelenskyy said.

8.title: Pune's weekly COVID positivity rate reaches 12.14%; 2nd highest in Maha
8.article_body: Pune's weekly COVID-19 positivity rate has reached 12.14%, the second highest in Maharashtra, officials said. "While districts like Pune and Mumbai reported a surge in COVID-19 cases, other districts did not. Now the cases in these districts see a decline, other districts are reporting a surge," an official said. Gondia district reported the highest weekly COVID-19 positivity rate at 12.37%.

9.title: 2 of family die, 2 injured as recently purchased AC explodes in Mumbai
9.article_body: Two members of a family were killed while two others were critically injured after an AC that was recently purchased by the family exploded in Mumbai. The blast, reports said, caused a level one fire. A neighbour said that the fire broke out while the family was sleeping. Laxmi Rathod and her daughter Madhu were killed in the incident.

10.title: Cook dies of snake bite at Hyderabad's Osmania University campus
10.article_body: A 45-yr-old cook died due to snake bite at Hyderabad's Osmania University campus on Wednesday night. The incident occurred when the woman, identified as Kavita, was working in the kitchen at Manjeera hostel. Kavita was rushed to Gandhi Hospital where she died during treatment, police said. Following the incident, students and employees demanded adequate steps against the problem.

11.title: Seats are filling fast for IIM Indore’s IPBA program : UNext Jigsaw
11.article_body: IIM Indore and UNext Jigsaw announced that very few seats remain for 14th batch of their online Integrated program in Business Analytics (IPBA) which covers subjects with 10+ graded assignments, industry-relevant case studies and capstone project. Moreover, 83% alums boosted their career with 48% average salary hike, it revealed. With IIM alum status, get access to its campus and library.

12.title: Google asks Apple to fix texting, says 'green bubbles make chats difficult to read'
12.article_body: Google has launched a campaign to pressure Apple into adopting RCS, a next-generation standard for text messaging. Google has asked Apple to "fix texting" between iPhone and Android devices, citing blurry videos, missing read receipts, and no texting over Wi-Fi. It has criticised the green-coloured bubbles for chats on iPhones with Android devices, saying it makes texts difficult to read.

13.title: I rejected Saif's marriage proposal twice before agreeing: Kareena
13.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor said she rejected husband and actor Saif Ali Khan's marriage proposal twice before agreeing. "He told me that in Greece and...in Ladakh...At that time, I was like, 'I don't know because I don't know you'...It was more like an 'I want to know you better'," added Kareena. "What's important is that finally I said yes," she stated.

14.title: B'luru AC bus fleet more than halved due to WFH, rising fuel costs
14.article_body: Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has reduced its AC bus fleet to 373 from 834 amid a lack of demand as many IT professionals are choosing to work from home (WFH), a BMTC official said. The official added that IT professionals use 90% of these buses. Rising fuel costs and operational charges are also a factor, another BMTC official stated.

15.title: Delhi LG orders FIR against 11 ex-DDA officials in 9-yr-old corruption case
15.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) VK Saxena has ordered the registration of FIRs against 11 former Delhi Development Authority (DDA) officials in a 2013 corruption case. The case pertains to the upgradation and beautification of Kingsway Camp's Coronation Park, the tender cost of which was ₹14.24 crore but additional work amounting to ₹114.83 crore was also carried out without any sanctions.

16.title: Water seen dripping on seats inside SpiceJet flight from Mumbai; video surfaces
16.article_body: A video showing water dripping on seats inside Mumbai-Jabalpur SpiceJet flight is being widely circulated online. Passengers said they were given different seats after complaining about water leakage, however, one of them still had water dripping in front of his seat. The passenger said he would complain about the matter to the Civil Aviation Ministry.

17.title: 3 men fire at Mumbai's Gazebo Market, threaten to kill stall vendors
17.article_body: Three men on a bike fired three rounds at the Gazebo Market on Linking Road in Mumbai's Bandra West. The incident took place on Thursday night. Reports said that the bikers also threatened to kill all those who had put up stalls in the area. Police reportedly said they suspect that people from the land mafia might be behind firing.

18.title: Asia's richest man Adani gets Z category security after intel flags threat: Report
18.article_body: Asia's richest man and Adani Group's 60-year-old Chairman Gautam Adani has been given Z category security cover from the central government, a report said. The decision is said to have been taken on the basis of a threat perception report by the Intelligence Bureau. Adani, who has a fortune of $126 billion, will reportedly bear the expenses for the security.

19.title: Car thief caught hiding inside giant 'breathing' teddy bear in UK; pics go viral
19.article_body: A man in the United Kingdom who was wanted for car theft was sent to jail on Friday after police found him hiding inside a giant teddy bear. Joshua Dobson, 18, had been wanted by the police since May. "Our officers noticed a large bear breathing in the address," the Greater Manchester Police wrote in a post on Facebook.

20.title: Urvashi responds after Pant says 'Leave me alone, sister'; calls him 'cougar hunter'
20.article_body: After cricketer Rishabh Pant seemingly responded to actress Urvashi Rautela's recent viral interview wherein she talked about a person named 'RP', Urvashi Rautela reacted via an Instagram post. "Chotu bhaiyaa should play bat ball," she wrote while adding #cougarhunter. Pant had written 'Leave me alone, sister' while seemingly responding to Urvashi's remark that 'RP' wanted to meet her in Delhi.

21.title: Could've finished Darlings scene early but Alia, Shefali kept laughing: Jasmeet
21.article_body: 'Darlings' director Jasmeet K Reen said that the team could have finished filming a scene three-four hours earlier but actresses Shefali Shah and Alia Bhatt kept laughing. "They would say half line and they would just keep laughing...They have that kind of energy on set...They're so into it, and positive and fun...that sometimes they are just cracking up," Jasmeet said.

22.title: Man claims to be James Bond from UK, cheats Mumbai woman of ₹5.07 lakh
22.article_body: A 27-year-old woman from Mumbai was cheated of ₹5.07 lakh by cyber frauds, who posed as a businessman from the UK and identified himself as 'James Bond'. Police said that the accused sent a parcel full of expensive gifts to India, following which they posed as government officials and made the victim deposit ₹5.07 lakh in various accounts.

23.title: 25-yr-old Bihar woman police constable found dead in Pune hotel room
23.article_body: A 25-year-old woman police constable from Bihar, who was in Pune as part of an investigation, was found dead in a hotel room on Thursday afternoon. A senior police officer said that while the preliminary probe points to suicide, senior officials from Pimpri Chinchwad and Muzaffarpur were coordinating with each other to investigate the cause of the death.

24.title: Maternal uncle allegedly rapes 16-year-old girl in Gurugram
24.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her maternal uncle in Gurugram, police said on Thursday. According to the girl's complaint, her uncle called her to his home in Bhondsi area, where he lives with his wife and son, to learn sewing on July 10. He raped the girl on July 28 and August 7, police said citing the complaint.

25.title: Inter-state human trafficking racket busted in Navi Mumbai; 17 rescued
25.article_body: Mumbai Police recently busted an inter-state human trafficking racket running in four Navi Mumbai flats and rescued 17 women hailing from West Bengal, Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh who were forced into prostitution. Police has arrested nine people and are looking for two main accused. The incident came to light after a 24-year-old woman managed to flee from the flat.

26.title: 27-yr-old Mumbai woman tries buying whiskey online, loses ₹5.35 lakh
26.article_body: A 27-year-old woman from Mumbai lost ₹5.35 lakh to frauds, who posed as wine shop executives and cheated her on the pretext of delivering a bottle of whiskey to her house. The accused also convinced the woman to increase her debit card limit that helped them withdraw ₹5.35 lakh from her account till Wednesday noon, a police official said.

27.title: Court acquits Mumbai man in rash driving case due to poor road condition
27.article_body: A 61-year-old man in Mumbai was acquitted in a rash driving case after the court noted that it appears it wasn't the accused's fault as the road at the accident site was dug up. The court noted that it's not sufficient to prove the accident took place by accused's vehicle. The victim had suffered a broken leg and ankle.

28.title: Pet pitbull dog attacks, seriously injures 35-yr-old house help in Gurugram
28.article_body: A pet pitbull dog allegedly attacked and seriously injured a 35-year-old house help who was on her way to work in Gurugram's Civil Lines area on Thursday morning. A police officer, requesting anonymity, said preliminary probe has found that the dog attacked her from behind and bit into her neck. The dog let her go after intervention from a passerby.

29.title: Australia cricketers donate tour prize money to children, families in crisis-hit SL
29.article_body: Australian men's cricket team players donated their prize money from the recent all-format tour of Sri Lanka to support children and families impacted by Sri Lanka's economic crisis. In all, the team donated AU$45,000 to UNICEF Australia's Sri Lanka appeal. "It was very clear to us how much day-to-day life for Sri Lankans is being impacted," Pat Cummins said.

30.title: Satellite photographs indicate serious damage to Crimea air base
30.article_body: Commercially available satellite photographs taken before and after purported explosions in Crimea's Saki air base earlier this week show heavy damage sustained by the station. Earlier, Russia, which controls Crimea, denied any attack in the peninsula and rubbished reports of any damage to its aircraft. Ukraine has claimed nine Russian aircraft were destroyed in Crimea.

31.title: Mohali Police arrest 2 for extorting businessmen in the district
31.article_body: Mohali Police have arrested two people who were involved in extorting businessmen in the district. The accused were members of a gang and were already wanted for firing outside a nightclub in March. According to Mohali Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Vivek Sheel Soni, the arrested would scare businessmen by firing outside their homes or offices to get money extorted.

32.title: Sitabuldi Fort to open as part of Independence Day celebrations
32.article_body: The Indian Army will open the Sitabuldi Fort as part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' to commemorate 75 years of India's independence. A symbol of military heritage, the fort is controlled by the Indian Army. It is only opened to the general public on specific days and this year, as an exception, will be open for two days.

33.title: British Instagrammer asked to leave Sri Lanka after she backed protesters
33.article_body: A British woman Instagrammer who was in Sri Lanka has been asked by authorities to leave the country before August 15 for participating in anti-government protests. Officials seized Kayleigh Fraser's passport to check if she had violated any of the visa conditions while staying in the crisis-hit country. Fraser had posted images and videos of the recent 'GotaGoHome' protest campaign.

34.title: BJP will be uprooted in 2024, will lose 40 LS seats in 3 states: JD(U)
34.article_body: Janata Dal (United) National President Lalan Singh on Thursday stated that BJP will be uprooted from power at the Centre in 2024. He added that BJP will lose 40 Lok Sabha seats out of its 2019 winning tally in three states — Bihar, Jharkhand and West Bengal. Singh made the remarks after meeting RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav.

35.title: Nykaa's CEO of private label division Reena Chhabra quits
35.article_body: In a regulatory filing, Nykaa said that the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of its private label division FSN Brands, Reena Chhabra, has resigned, with effect from August 16. Earlier, she worked with cosmetic brand Colorbar as their COO and joined Nykaa in 2016. According to the draft red herring prospectus, she was paid a total of ₹3.06 crore in FY21.

36.title: BankBazaar.com to raise $100 mn in 3 years: CEO Adhil Shetty
36.article_body: BankBazaar.com is looking to raise $100 million in the next three years to aid the company's accelerating business practices, Founder and CEO Adhil Shetty said. The company expects to grow 80-90% in FY23, he added. Shetty said that the fintech firm achieved breakeven on a month-on-month basis in March 2022, and that they are currently not looking for immediate capital.

37.title: Pant honoured by Uttarakhand CM, months after being appointed state brand ambassador
37.article_body: Cricketer Rishabh Pant was on Thursday honoured by Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami in a programme organised at Uttarakhand Sadan in New Delhi, months after being appointed as the brand ambassador of the state. "It's no doubt a great feeling and also a huge responsibility," Pant wrote while sharing a picture on Instagram. Pant was born in Uttarakhand's Haridwar.

38.title: People chant 'chor-chor' as TMC leader Mondal is produced before court
38.article_body: Unidentified people chanted "chor-chor" (thief-thief) outside a CBI court in West Bengal's Asansol when Trinamool Congress (TMC) Birbhum district president Anubrata Mondal arrived there for a hearing on Thursday. People also showed black flags and shoes at his arrival. Mondal was arrested on Thursday in a cattle smuggling scam case. The CBI court has sent him to a 10-day custody.

39.title: Indian fintech startups to have $1 trillion assets by 2030: Report
39.article_body: Indian financial technology startups will have $1 trillion assets under management (AUM) and $200 billion revenue by 2030, a report by venture capital firm Chiratae Ventures and EY India said. The report added that fintechs' AUM in 2021 was around $100 billion and revenue around $20 billion. The digital lending market is expected to grow to $515 billion by 2030.

40.title: Tripura receives ₹50 cr to upgrade sports infrastructure in state
40.article_body: Tripura Sports Minister Sushanta Chowdhury announced that the state and central governments have sanctioned ₹50 crore to upgrade sports infrastructure in the state. "We want to develop sports infrastructure to ensure more good players come up. Also, sports will ensure youths don't take the path of drugs," he said. The government also decided to induct 100 new junior physical instructors.

41.title: Latvian Parliament declares Russia a 'state sponsor of terrorism'
41.article_body: The Latvian Parliament has declared Russia a “state sponsor of terrorism” for allegedly attacking civilians in its invasion of Ukraine. A strongly worded statement adopted by lawmakers in Riga said Moscow was using “suffering and intimidation as tools in its attempts to demoralise the Ukrainian people". In the 100-seat assembly, 67 lawmakers voted in favour of adopting the statement.

42.title: His condition has neither improved nor worsened: Raju Srivastava's daughter
42.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava continues to remain in the Intensive Care Unit of AIIMS after suffering from a heart attack. His daughter Antara, while sharing an update about his health, told Times of India, "His condition has neither improved nor worsened. The entire medical team is doing their best." "We are praying and hoping he will be fine soon," she added.

43.title: Speculation of my exit only strengthens my position: Bommai
43.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that speculations about his replacement will only strengthen his position. Calling the rumours politically motivated, Bommai said, "I have come to accept the situation. I know the truth. I know that there is no basis for this speculation." Bommai's remarks come amid Congress party's social media messages stating that the BJP will replace him.

44.title: Spain evacuates another 294 Afghan refugees
44.article_body: The Spanish government has evacuated another 294 refugees from Afghanistan to the country, via Pakistan, officials said on Thursday. Since August last year, Spain has evacuated to Madrid 3,900 people from the war-torn nation. The evacuated persons include people who had worked for the Spanish government or its troops stationed in Afghanistan before the Taliban took over.

45.title: Do you think I have become old: Babar Azam to reporter asking if he should quit 1 format
45.article_body: After a reporter asked him if he should quit one format due to workload, Pakistan captain Babar Azam replied, "Do you think I have become old?" Babar added, "The kind of fitness that we have, I don't think we should limit ourselves to two formats." He further said, "If workload is high then we will increase our fitness levels."

46.title: MI Cape Town announce their first group of players for upcoming T20 league
46.article_body: MI Cape Town today announced the signing of five players ahead of the inaugural edition of Cricket South Africa T20 League. The players include Kagiso Rabada, Dewald Brevis, Rashid Khan, Sam Curran and Liam Livingstone. The players have been signed ahead of the auctions as per the rules that govern the T20 league, MI said.

47.title: Truck full of migrants overturns in North Macedonia; 35 injured
47.article_body: A truck carrying 49 Syrian migrants overturned on a road in North Macedonia, causing injuries to 35 people, police said on Thursday. The migrants are believed to have entered North Macedonia from neighbouring Greece. The truck driver escaped on foot from the accident scene on Wednesday and is suspected to be part of a migrant smuggling ring.

48.title: Was like hearing KK: Leslee Lewis on recording 'Yaaron' with KK's son
48.article_body: Music composer Leslee Lewis opened up on his experience of re-recording 'Yaaron Dosti' song with late singer KK's son Nakul and daughter Tamara. He said recording with Nakul was "unbelievable". "It was like I was hearing KK," he shared. The original version of the song, sung by KK, was recorded 23 years ago.

49.title: Shehbaz is very protective of me: Shehnaaz Gill
49.article_body: Bigg Boss 13 fame Shehnaaz Gill opened up about her relationship with brother Shehbaz. She said, "Shehbaz is very protective of me. Every brother-sister should be that for each other." Crediting Shehnaaz for his success, Shehbaz said he is 'very lucky' to have her in life. On the work front, Shehnaaz is set to make her Bollywood debut.

50.title: Congress MLA Sudip attacked in Tripura, hospitalised; party blames BJP
50.article_body: Congress MLA Sudip Roy Barman sustained head injuries on Thursday after being attacked by unidentified people during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Agartala, Tripura. He's undergoing treatment at hospital. Tripura Congress blamed "BJP goons" for the attack on Sudip and other leaders. Congress' Birajit Singh said miscreants had thrown stones at Sudip's car. Other Congress members were also injured.

51.title: Scriptures like Manusmriti give respectable position to women: HC Judge
51.article_body: Delhi High Court judge Justice Prathiba M Singh has said that the Indian women "are a blessed lot" since scriptures like Manusmriti give a very respectable position to them. She added that India is more progressive about women being in leadership roles. Women are respected in Asian countries because of the cultural and religious background of scriptures, she further said.

52.title: 160 grams of heroin seized in Haryana's Ambala, 2 arrested
52.article_body: The police on Thursday arrested two men, Arvind and Vijay, with 160 grams of heroin from a village near Ambala cantonment in Haryana, officials said. Acting on a tip off, a police team stopped a car at a check post on Ambala-Delhi highway, they added. During the search, police recovered the drugs from two men, both residents of Ambala Cantonment.

53.title: 'Dream Girl 2' to star Ananya, Paresh Rawal, Seema Pahwa: Reports
53.article_body: The makers of 'Dream Girl 2' have reportedly shortlisted the cast of the film. As per a report, Ananya Panday, Paresh Rawal and Seema Pahwa will be joining Ayushmann Khurrana, who will be reprising his role. 'Dream Girl 2' is the sequel of 2019 film with the same name. It was directed by Raaj Shaandilyaa.

54.title: Shashi Tharoor to be conferred France's highest civilian award
54.article_body: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor is set to be conferred with France's highest civilian award Chevalier de la Legion d'Honneur for his writings and speeches. French Ambassador to India Emmanuel Lenain wrote to Tharoor, informing him about the award. "I am honoured to be recognised in this way. My gratitude and appreciation," Tharoor said.

55.title: Dozens missing as migrant boat sinks off Greece's coast
55.article_body: A Greek navy vessel and three merchant ships were on a search and rescue operation on Thursday after a boat carrying migrants sank off the southeastern coast of Greece on Wednesday, officials said. Only 29 men from Afghanistan, Iran and Iraq have been rescued till now. Survivors told officials that 60 to 80 people were onboard the boat.

56.title: Cameroon troops killed 10 people in crackdown on separatists: NGO
56.article_body: Cameroonian troops "summarily killed" at least 10 people during President Paul Biya's crackdown on Anglophone separatists earlier in the year, a report by Human Rights Watch said on Thursday. "The troops also burned 12 homes, destroyed, and looted health facilities," the report stated. The report comes as fighting between security forces and militants have intensified recently.

57.title: Woman spends ₹48 lakh to look like Kim Kardashian in South Korea, pics surface
57.article_body: Cherrie Lee, 28, from South Korea has undergone 15 surgeries in eight years to look like Kim Kardashian. "Whenever I have to explain to someone that I'm Korean and they [say]...I don't look [like] it, I feel unique and exotic," she stated. She has spent £50,000 (over ₹48 lakh) on procedures including Brazilian butt lifts, breast augmentations and facial surgeries.

58.title: Centre waives off taxes for rich, but imposes it on poor: Kejriwal
58.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday attacked the Centre and said the Centre provides tax waivers for the rich, but overburdens the poor with taxes. "What was the condition of the central government that it was time to impose tax on the poorest of the poor?" Kejriwal questioned. Kejriwal further criticised the Centre's Agnipath scheme.

59.title: Nobody can force anyone to buy the national flag: Haryana CM
59.article_body: Amid reports that a Karnal ration depot compelled people to buy the tricolour, Haryana CM Manohar Khattar on Thursday clarified that nobody can force anyone to buy the flag. "No person will be denied...services even if he doesn't wish to buy the national flag. Under 'Har Ghar Tiranga Abhiyan', people can voluntarily buy the flag," CM said in a statement.

60.title: People took my self-confidence for arrogance: KGF actor Yash
60.article_body: Kannada actor Yash said his self-confidence made him what he is today. However, he said a few years ago, his self-confidence was mistaken for arrogance. "When I spoke with self-confidence like this a few years ago, some may have thought I was arrogant," he said. The 'KGF' star added that his belief in himself has brought respect to Kannada cinema.

61.title: 51-yr-old Norwegian woman staying illegally in India held in Manipur
61.article_body: A 51-year-old Norwegian woman has been arrested in the border town of Moreh in Manipur for illegally staying in India, the Assam Rifles said on Thursday. Mya Kyay Mon, who arrived in India in 2020, was intercepted at the foreigners' checkpost in Khudengthabi while she was travelling to Kolkata, it said. Her passport and visa had expired, it added.

62.title: He asked me to send girls to his bungalow every night: Hostel warden on MP SDM
62.article_body: A former warden of a government-run girls hostel in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri district alleged that the then-district coordinator Bijender Singh Yadav, who's currently an SDM, used to ask her to "send girls to his bungalow" every night. She added he used to threaten her with transfer in case his demands weren't met. An inquiry has been launched into the matter.

63.title: Woman spends ₹48 lakh to look like Kim Kardashian, says 'People don't believe I'm Korean'
63.article_body: Cherrie Lee, 28, from South Korea has undergone 15 surgeries in eight years to look like Kim Kardashian. "Whenever I have to explain to someone that I'm Korean and they [say]...I don't look [like] it, I feel unique and exotic," she stated. She has spent £50,000 (over ₹48 lakh) on procedures including Brazilian butt lifts, breast augmentations and facial surgeries.

64.title: Kejriwal has given 'perverse twist' to freebies debate: Sitharaman
64.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday took a jibe at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, saying he had given a "perverse twist" to the debate on freebies as health and education were never considered giveaways. Sitharaman said that by classifying education and health as freebies, Kejriwal was trying to instil fear in the minds of the poor.

65.title: 4 killed, several missing as boat capsizes in UP's Banda due to strong winds
65.article_body: At least four people were killed and several went missing after a boat carrying around 35 people capsized in the Yamuna river in Uttar Pradesh's Banda. The boat capsized due to strong winds, the Superintendent of Police said. As per local residents, many of them were going to celebrate Raksha Bandhan with their siblings.

66.title: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict moves SC for premature release
66.article_body: Nalini Sriharan, a life convict in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, moved the Supreme Court on Thursday seeking premature release. She cited the court's judgement in the case where co-convict AG Perarivalan was released from prison. "Tamil Nadu [Council] had recommended [the] Governor to release the…convicts in 2018. But…the Governor sent the issue to the President," her lawyer said.

67.title: Self-driving Tesla Model 3 runs down child dummy in multiple safety tests
67.article_body: The Dawn Project CEO Dan O'Dowd has posted a video of a Tesla Model 3 equipped with Full Self-Driving (FSD) software running down a child mannequin placed in its path during safety tests. O'Dowd claimed there wasn't any interference or input from the test driver. He demanded a ban on FSD software until Tesla "proves it won't mow down children".

68.title: KL Rahul to lead India in 3-match ODI series against Zimbabwe, Dhawan named his deputy
68.article_body: Batter KL Rahul has been declared fit for the three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe, the BCCI said. Rahul will be leading the squad in the series, while Shikhar Dhawan, who was initially named captain, has now been named Rahul's deputy. The ODI series will begin on August 18, while the last ODI will take place on August 22.

69.title: Armed man takes Beirut bank staff hostage, demands his trapped savings
69.article_body: A Lebanese man armed with a shotgun has taken hostages at a Beirut bank and threatened to set himself on fire unless he receives his trapped savings to pay his father's medical bills. Soldiers and police converged on the area and sought a negotiation. Lebanon's cash-strapped banks since 2019 have put strict limits on withdrawals of foreign currency assets.

70.title: In veiled attack at Nitish, Minister shares clip showing dog fighting 2 lions
70.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh, on Thursday, tweeted a video showing a dog trying to fight two lions and captioned it "Challenge 2024", which he later deleted. The video came a day after Bihar CM Nitish Kumar asserted that the NDA government needs to worry about the 2024 LS polls. "The RJD's plan to loot Bihar has begun," Singh said.

71.title: Pics of Kobe's remains after crash shared by police, firefighters for a laugh, court told
71.article_body: The pictures of Kobe Bryant's remains after the helicopter crash were shared by LA County police and firefighters "for a laugh", Kobe's wife Vanessa's attorney Luis Li told a court during Vanessa's invasion of privacy trial against the county. "They were shared by deputies playing video games...They were shared...with people who had absolutely no reason to receive them," he added.

72.title: TMC has become a party of thieves: WB Cong chief Adhir Chowdhury
72.article_body: After TMC's Anubrata Mondal was arrested by CBI in connection with the cattle smuggling scam, West Bengal Congress chief Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said TMC has become a party of thieves. "CM Mamata Banerjee and TMC leaders are involved in scams," Chowdhury said. "Such scams are not possible without the support of government and the police," he added.

73.title: 27-year-old American tourist raped in public toilet in Paris
73.article_body: An American woman was allegedly raped in a public toilet in Paris on Saturday. The 27-year-old was walking with her boyfriend along the River Seine across Notre Dame Cathedral when she stopped to use a public bathroom at around 1 am. The suspect, a 23-year-old man, was charged with rape and kept in custody.

74.title: Self-proclaimed politician Shrikant Tyagi's bail plea rejected
74.article_body: A court has rejected a bail plea filed by self-proclaimed politician Shrikant Tyagi, who is accused of molesting and abusing a woman in Noida. He was arrested from Meerut on Tuesday after absconding for days. Tyagi's lawyer Sushil Bhati said they will now approach the sessions court to contest this judgment.

75.title: US Justice dept to sue Google next month over ad market domination: Report
75.article_body: The US Department of Justice (DOJ) is preparing to sue Google as soon as next month over the firm's alleged illegal domination of the digital advertising market, Bloomberg reported. Lawyers of DOJ's antitrust division are reportedly questioning publishers in another round of interviews to refresh facts. DOJ's previous lawsuit against Google alleged that it dominates the online search market.

76.title: ED, CBI can set up offices at my residence if it brings peace: Tejashwi
76.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said he was far from being afraid of ED and CBI and was ready to let them set up offices at his residence if this brought peace. "If even this doesn't bring "shanti" (peace), I cannot help," Tejashwi said. He claimed he did not fear these agencies even during his first tenure as deputy CM.

77.title: 2 govt officials caught red-handed while accepting bribes in Assam
77.article_body: Police on Thursday said two government officials were caught red-handed while allegedly accepting bribes in Assam. Gopinath Das, working in the office of sub-registrar in Tamulpur, was caught while accepting bribe money, Anti-corruption and Vigilance director said. In the second incident, Lohit Phukan, working in the office of Inspector of Excise in Bokakhat, was apprehended with money, he added.

78.title: Suspected Maoists abduct, kill villager in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
78.article_body: Suspected Maoists abducted and killed a villager in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district, police said on Thursday, adding the reason behind the murder was yet to be ascertained. Security personnel on Thursday recovered the body of the deceased villager, Gopiram Madkam, near his village Kahurgaon, a senior official said. Madkam was abducted from his village on August 8, the official added.

79.title: Man, wife kill 4 relatives over property in Howrah: Police
79.article_body: A man and his wife allegedly killed four of their family members over a property dispute in Howrah, West Bengal, police said on Thursday. While accused Debraj Ghosh is on the run, his wife Pallavi Ghosh was arrested. The accused allegedly stabbed Debraj's mother, his brother, sister-in-law and niece on Wednesday night, officials said.

80.title: Tyre of Coast Guard's Dornier aircraft bursts at Goa airport
80.article_body: A tyre of an Indian Coast Guard Dornier aircraft has burst during routine tests on a runway at the Dabolim airport in Goa, an official said. The incident delayed several flights operating from the airport since afternoon. The Coast Guard functions from the INS Hansa naval base, which is also home to the Dabolim civilian airport.

81.title: Will beat him, set venue on fire: BJP MLA on Munawar's Hyd show
81.article_body:
After stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui announced that he'll hold a show in Hyderabad,
BJP MLA T Raja Singh threatened to cancel the programme. In a video message, Singh said, "Wherever the programme is held, we shall beat him up...We shall set [the venue] on fire." He added, "We shall...teach him a lesson for abusing...Lord Ram if he comes to Telangana."

82.title: Influencer, who smoked inside flight, booked for drinking liquor in the middle of road
82.article_body: A case has been registered against social media influencer Bobby Kataria at Dehradun's Cantt police station for allegedly consuming liquor in the middle of a road in Uttarakhand. While sharing the video on Instagram, he had written, "It's time to enjoy on the roads." Earlier, a video of the influencer smoking inside a SpiceJet flight had gone viral.

83.title: Arjun Tendulkar to leave Mumbai, likely to play for Goa: Reports
83.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun Tendulkar will likely represent Goa in the upcoming domestic season, reports said. Arjun has applied for a No Objection Certificate from Mumbai Cricket Association. "Getting maximum game time...is important for him at this juncture of his career. We believe...the shift will improve...probability of him featuring in more competitive matches," SRT Sports Management said.

84.title: UP woman kills husband, buries body in house after quarrel: Police
84.article_body: A woman allegedly killed her husband and buried his body in their house after a quarrel in Uttar Pradesh's Khamaria on Sunday, police said. However, the woman told the police that her husband, Govind, hanged himself following the quarrel. She claimed that she got scared after Govind's death and dug a pit in their house and buried the body there.

85.title: No-confidence motion against Himachal govt defeated by voice vote
85.article_body: A no-confidence motion moved by Congress and CPI-M against the BJP government in Himachal Pradesh was defeated by a voice vote in the Assembly on Thursday. The Opposition MLAs walked out of the Assembly during Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur's reply. They criticised the government over several issues, including law and order, unemployment and price rise.

86.title: Salman Khan spends a day with Indian Navy sailors, pics surface
86.article_body: Actor Salman Khan on Thursday spent his day with sailors of the Indian Navy onboard INS Visakhapatnam. The pictures of the actor have gone viral on social media platforms. In the photos, he is seen interacting, working out and dancing with the sailors. Salman is currently shooting in Hyderabad for his upcoming film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'.

87.title: It hurts: Raqesh on hate against Ridhi after split with Shamita
87.article_body: Actor Raqesh Bapat said it 'hurts' to think about the hate his ex-wife Ridhi Dogra is receiving after his breakup with Shamita Shetty. Fans blamed Ridhi for Raqesh-Shamita's split. "She has been getting the crap from the audience for no reason. When there's no truth to the fact," he said. He added a third person can never break a relationship.

88.title: Gurugram makes background checks must for bouncers after guests beaten up outside club
88.article_body: Gurugram Police Commissioner Kala Ramachandran on Thursday made police verification and background checks mandatory for all the security staff working in bars and clubs. This comes a day after bouncers at a club beat up some men for opposing the alleged molestation of their female friend. Action will be taken against those agencies that don't get verification checks done.

89.title: 4 transport 30 kg of ganja from AP to Hyd, arrested
89.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday arrested four persons of an inter-state gang and seized 30 kgs of ganja. The police arrested four of the seven-member gang and seized an auto and four mobile phones from them, all worth ₹9 lakh. One of the accused (Krishanaveni), has been peddling ganja for around four years, Rachakonda Police said.

90.title: Help us bring back body or get us visa: Brother of Indian woman who died by suicide in US
90.article_body: The family of Mandeep Kaur, who died by suicide in US allegedly over domestic abuse, is seeking help from government to enable them to either bring her body to India or arrange visa to perform last rites. However, as per the family, they haven't received any response from officials. "We...don't know what will happen with the body," said Mandeep's brother.

91.title: Four more held for attempting to kill TRS MLA in Hyderabad
91.article_body: The Hyderabad Police have arrested four more people for attempting to kill legislator, A Jeevan Reddy, of the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS). The four accused - Santosh, Suguna, Surender and Sagar - aided the main accused, Paddagani Prasad Goud, in executing his plan to kill the MLA. Prasad Goud, a TRS leader, was arrested by the police on August 8.

92.title: 7 kidnap friend who won ₹1 crore in online games in K'taka, arrested
92.article_body: Seven people were arrested in Karnataka for allegedly kidnapping their friend, who won over ₹1 crore in online games. The accused called the victim's father and demanded ₹1 crore as ransom, which the father refused to pay, reports said. However, the accused settled for ₹15 lakh and threatened to kill the victim if the ransom wasn't paid.

93.title: Punjab CM accepts resignation of VC who was asked by minister to lie down on dirty bed
93.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Singh Mann on Thursday accepted the resignation of Baba Farid University of Health Sciences, Faridkot, Vice-Chancellor Dr Raj Bahadur. He resigned on July 30, a day after Punjab Health Minister Chetan Singh Jauramajra forced him to lie down on a dirty bed at the university during an inspection. Dr Bahadur earlier said he felt humiliated.

94.title: Actor Vishal gets injured while shooting an action sequence: Reports
94.article_body: Actor Vishal got injured while shooting for an action sequence of his upcoming film 'Mark Antony'. As per the reports, the actor was rushed to a private hospital in Chennai. He has reportedly sustained a knee injury. The shoot of 'Mark Antony' is currently on hold. The actor will resume the shooting after his recovery.

95.title: Hyderabad on high alert ahead of Independence Day celebrations
95.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day celebrations, a high alert has been sounded in Hyderabad after reports from the Intelligence Bureau. Following the reports, security at temples, mosques, tourist places, bus and railway stations and other crowded places has been increased. To monitor the situation, additional security forces have also been deployed at hotels and other public places in the city.

96.title: Trial of German soldier who faces Russia spy charges begins
96.article_body: A German soldier Ralph G. who allegedly shared information with Russian intelligence services has been put on trial. Ralph G. has been accused of sharing excerpts from an official government document on Germany's relationship with Russia in the wake of annexation of Crimea in 2014. According to reports, information was shared via phone calls, email and messaging service WhatsApp.

97.title: Randeep Hooda remembers Sarabjit's sister Dalbir on Raksha Bandhan
97.article_body: Remembering Dalbir Kaur on Raksha Bandhan, Randeep Hooda penned a note in which he mentioned how he is realising the significance of her rakhi. He said he is sure that her blessings are always with him. Dalbir pronounced Randeep her brother after he played the role of her late brother Sarabjit Singh in the 2016 film 'Sarbjit'.

98.title: Gujarat govt unveils drone policy, expects to create 25,000 jobs
98.article_body: The Gujarat government has unveiled a new Drone Promotion and Usage Policy for state departments and organisations, which is aimed at the promotion and use of drones for operations and delivery of services. The state government expects that this policy will create 25,000 jobs and attract investments. The policy allows different departments to use drones for various operational requirements.

99.title: Bengaluru Police files chargesheet in Rakesh Tikait ink attack case
99.article_body: Bengaluru Police has filed a 450-page chargesheet in the case of a man throwing ink on Bharatiya Kisan Union national spokesperson Rakesh Tikait at Gandhi Bhavan in the city on May 30. The chargesheet records the accounts of 20 eyewitnesses and has named 89 witnesses. It also contains details on people who were arrested, including Hindutva activist Bharath Shetty.

100.title: Lebanon court orders property seizure of MPs charged over 2020 blast
100.article_body: According to reports, a Lebanese court has ordered temporary seizure of property owned by two parliamentarians who face charges in connection with Beirut port blast of 2020 in which more than 200 people were killed. Under the order, property worth about $3 million is to be confiscated. The exact charges have not been revealed but both parliamentarians deny wrongdoing.

101.title: Nitish Kumar created storm which can challenge BJP: Shiv Sena
101.article_body: The Shiv Sena on Thursday said Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar had created a political "storm" by breaking ties with the BJP and this could challenge the BJP in the 2024 general elections. Sena's Marathi publication ‘Saamana’ also praised RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav. Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP in Bihar on Tuesday to form the 'Mahagathbandhan' alliance.

102.title: SoftBank looking to sell shares in FirstCry, valuing company at $4 bn: Reports
102.article_body: Japan-based SoftBank, and NewQuest Capital Partners are reportedly looking to sell shares of IPO-bound FirstCry in the secondary market. From the share-sale, the company is being valued between $3.5-$4 billion. As per a report, SoftBank which is the largest shareholder in FirstCry is planning to reduce its 29% stake to under 25% with the sale.

103.title: BJP leader's illegal structure demolished in UP after complaint
103.article_body: An alleged illegal structure belonging to BJP leader Satya Prakash Singh was demolished in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, by Varanasi Development Authority (VDA) on Thursday. Satya alias Akhand Singh is Varanasi BJP District Vice-President. VDA said a room had been built illegally in a housing society named Varuna Enclave in Sikraul. It was demolished after some female residents filed a complaint.

104.title: Andhra woman kills sister's daughter-in-law, reaches police with severed head
104.article_body: A woman in Andhra Pradesh's Annamayya allegedly killed her sister's 35-year-old daughter-in-law and reached the police station, which was about six kilometres away, with her severed head to surrender. Police suspect that domestic problems and property dispute led to the woman, Subbamma, killing the victim, Vasundhara. Subbamma's relatives were also allegedly involved in Vasundhara's murder.

105.title: Nitish made up his mind to quit NDA after call with Sonia Gandhi: JD(U) leader
105.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar made up his mind to quit NDA after he called Congress chief Sonia Gandhi to inquire about her health, a JD(U) leader said. "Kumar firmed up exit plan after getting Gandhi's nod for support," the JD(U) leader said, requesting anonymity. JD(U) leader VK Chaudhary said Kumar was also in touch with RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav.

106.title: What excuse will BJP give for increasing crime in Delhi: Chidambaram
106.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram criticised the Centre on Thursday over the law and order in Delhi and asked what excuses will the BJP give for the "alarmingly deteriorating" crime situation in the city. "Delhi registered 1,100 cases of rape in the 196 days of this year up to July 15. That is over 5 cases a day!" Chidambaram said.

107.title: Congress to hold 'Mehangai Chaupals', mega rally in Delhi over price rise
107.article_body: Congress has announced that it'll continue its fight against price rise by organising 'Mehangai Chaupal' meetings in all Assembly constituencies from August 17-23. A mega rally called 'Mehangai Par Halla Bol' will be held on August 28 at Delhi's Ramlila Maidan. Congress said state Congress committees will hold 'Mehangai Par Halla Bol-Chalo Dilli' events at state, district and block levels.

108.title: 3 more accused arrested in K'taka BJP youth leader's murder case
108.article_body: Three more persons accused in the murder of Karnataka BJP youth leader Praveen Nettaru were arrested early on Thursday morning, a senior police official said. "Earlier, we had arrested seven people who were part of the conspiracy," Mangaluru ADGP Alok Kumar said. Praveen Nettaru was hacked to death by bike-borne miscreants on July 26 in Dakshina Kannada district's Bellare.

109.title: 27-yr-old man dies after bike hits parked truck from behind in Surat
109.article_body: Police said that a 27-year-old man, identified as Vipul Mohan Parmar, died on the spot after his bike hit a parked truck from behind in Gujarat's Surat district on Wednesday night. Parmar was returning home after visiting his sister's house at Baben village as part of Raksha Bandhan celebrations, they added. Police have lodged a complaint against the truck owner.

110.title: Income Tax officials put 'Rahul weds Anjali' posters on 120 cars, conduct raids in Maha
110.article_body: The Income Tax officials carried out raids from August 1 to 8 in a secret manner at multiple locations linked to some business groups accused of tax evasion in Maharashtra's Jalna. The officials arrived at the locations disguised as baratis. Around 120 cars, with posters of 'Rahul weds Anjali', were used for the raids. They seized illegal assets worth crores.

111.title: Dreams of becoming PM made Nitish betray people's mandate: Ex-Bihar Dy CM
111.article_body: Former Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tarkishore Prasad on Thursday alleged that Nitish Kumar's "dreams of becoming PM" made him "betray the mandate of the people" and join hands with the RJD. The BJP leader alleged that Kumar "went quiet" on the issue of corruption after joining the grand alliance, of which Lalu Prasad Yadav's RJD is a part.

112.title: Will closely cooperate with authorities to resolve BGMI ban: Krafton
112.article_body: Krafton will closely cooperate with authorities in India to reinstate the suspended battle royale game Battlegrounds Mobile India (BGMI), the South Korean firm's CFO Bae Dong-geun said on Thursday. "We fully respect and understand the Indian government's concern," he added. BGMI was pulled off Google Play Store and Apple App Store on July 28 following an interim government order.

113.title: 32-yr-old man steals idols of Hanuman, Durga from Mumbai temple; held
113.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested by the Shivaji Nagar Police for allegedly stealing idols of Hanuman and Durga from a temple in Mumbai's Govandi on August 3. The police said that the accused had escaped with two idols, adding that they were recovered after his arrest. The accused also stole a puja thali made of brass.

114.title: Binance says it is seeing surge in clients due to rising inflation
114.article_body: Binance is seeing a surge in clients due to rising inflation and a historically strong dollar that has depressed emerging market currencies, said Maximiliano Hinz, who heads Binance in Latin America. Hinz said Argentina, where annual inflation is at 90%, has emerged as one of Binance's top markets. "More people are seeking crypto...to protect themselves from inflation," Hinz said.

115.title: UN releases list of countries with highest digital currency ownership in 2021, India 7th
115.article_body: The United Nations Conference on Trade and Development has released a list of top 20 countries with highest digital currency ownership in 2021. Ukraine topped the list with 12.7%, followed by Russia (11.9%), Venezuela (10.3%), Singapore (9.4%), Kenya (8.5%) and the US (8.3%). India is seventh on the list, with 7.3% of the population owning digital currency in 2021.

116.title: Absolutely overwhelming: Actor Roshan Mathew on 'Darlings' success
116.article_body: Actor Roshan Mathew has thanked the audience for watching his latest film 'Darlings'. Calling its success "absolutely overwhelming," the actor said that all the "criticisms, debates and opinions" he has received from the audience will help him in the long run. 'Darlings' stars Alia Bhatt in the lead role.

117.title: Cisco hit by cyberattack, hacker tried to access corporate network
117.article_body: Cisco Systems said that a hacker tried to gain access to its corporate network and was preparing to encrypt files but couldn't manage to do so as it was detected and booted out. Cisco came to know of the potential compromise in May but revealed it on Wednesday after a list of stolen files was leaked on the dark web.

118.title: Oil price steadies after IEA raises 2022 demand growth outlook
118.article_body: After the International Energy Agency (IEA) raised its oil demand growth forecast for 2022 by 3,80,000 barrels per day, oil prices steadied on Thursday. Brent crude futures fell 7 cents to $97.33 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude futures eased 9 cents to $91.84. "Natural gas and electricity prices have soared to new records," the IEA said.

119.title: Pune Police arrest eatery staff for stabbing colleague to death
119.article_body: After an eatery employee, Sunil Namdeo Sarode, was found dead with stab wounds in Pune's Shirur, the Pune Rural police arrested his colleague from Maharashtra's Palghar, officials said. Investigation revealed that another eatery staff, Ananta Raghunath Kamble and Sarode had fought the previous night. "Kamble attacked Sarode with a butcher knife...and fled with the weapon," police said.

120.title: Sensex, Nifty end on strong note led by IT, realty, banking stocks
120.article_body: Benchmark indices ended on a strong note with Sensex up 515.31 points at 59,332.60 and Nifty at 17,659. Axis Bank, Bajaj Finance, HDFC, Tech Mahindra and TCS were among the major gainers on Nifty, while Tata Consumer Products, Apollo Hospitals, ITC, Hindalco Industries and NTPC slipped. Information Technology, PSU Bank, capital goods and realty stocks ended in the green.

121.title: Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi share childhood photos on Rakshabandhan
121.article_body: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra took to Twitter on Rakshabandhan to share their photos from the past which included their childhood photos and a photo from Priyanka's wedding ceremony. Notably, Priyanka Gandhi tested positive for COVID-19 on Wednesday and has been isolating at home.

122.title: China’s vehicle sales rise 29.7% in July as COVID-19 curbs ease
122.article_body: Auto sales in China rose by 29.7% to 2.42 million units in July from the year-ago period. This was driven by the easing of COVID-19 restrictions and government incentives. The China Association of Automobile Manufacturers' data, however, showed that sales for the first seven months were still 2% lower than the corresponding period in 2021.

123.title: Video shows DMK councillor's husband trying to attack people with machete
123.article_body: A video showing Vetrichelvan, the husband of Tamil Nadu DMK councillor Nithya, trying to attack people with a machete following an argument has surfaced online. The argument took place as Vetrichelvan hadn't returned the ₹2.60 lakh he had borrowed from Gunasekara. While arguing, Vetrichelvan suddenly reaches for the machete and attempts to attack people while chasing them.

124.title: Married daughters also entitled to compensation by insurance companies: K’taka HC
124.article_body: Married daughters are entitled to compensation by insurance companies on the loss of their parents in accidents, Karnataka High Court has held. The Supreme Court has held that married sons are also entitled to compensation in such cases, the HC said. "The very contention that married daughters of deceased are not entitled for compensation cannot be accepted," the court stated.

125.title: Johnny Depp's 1st look from his 1st film after Amber Heard trial released
125.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp's first look as King Louis XV from the upcoming film 'Jeanne du Barry' has been released. It'll be Depp's first film since he won the defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. 'Jeanne du Barry' is directed by French filmmaker Maiwenn and its filming is said to have started at the end of July.

126.title: New equation will be formed in Bihar, wait & watch: RLJP chief
126.article_body: As Nitish Kumar took oath as Bihar CM for the eighth time, RLJP chief Pashupati Kumar Paras said a new equation will be formed in Bihar because in politics, equations are made and deteriorated. "There's a time of over three years and we have to wait and watch the situation. The Assembly polls in Bihar are in 2025," Paras added.

127.title: Country is sinking & you're talking about Bollywood: Anurag Kashyap
127.article_body: Reacting to a claim that 'Bollywood is sinking', filmmaker Anurag Kashyap said, "The country is sinking. The world is sinking and you're talking about Bollywood." He further spoke about the heat wave in Europe and the melting ice caps. "You won't see the Maldives in a while," the filmmaker said. Anurag's next directorial 'Dobaaraa' will release on August 19.

128.title: You're always worried about Kuldeep's consistency, Bishnoi more reliable: Styris
128.article_body: Ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris has said Kuldeep Yadav's consistency might be the reason for his non-selection in India's squad for the Asia Cup. "Kuldeep can fall off a cliff a little bit under pressure," he stated. Styris further said Ravi Bishnoi is "probably a little more reliable" and that's why the 21-year-old has been named in the 15-member squad.

129.title: AAP relishes in insulting athletes, soldiers: BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla
129.article_body: BJP’s Shehzad Poonawalla criticised AAP after Indian wrestler Divya Kakran shared certificate to prove she had represented Delhi at a tournament, after AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj said Kakran always represented UP. "If there's one party that always relishes in insulting those who raise honour of our Tricolour, be it a 'jawan' (soldier) or a 'khiladi' (athlete), it's AAP," Poonawalla added.

130.title: Nitish-led govt's floor test to prove majority in Bihar Assembly on August 24
130.article_body: Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government's floor test to prove the majority in the state Legislative Assembly has been scheduled for August 24. This comes a day after JD(U) leader Nitish took oath as Bihar Chief Minister for the eighth time in his political career. Rashtriya Janata Dal's Tejashwi Yadav took oath as the Deputy CM of the state.

131.title: Karnataka HC puts on hold BBMP ward reservation till August 16
131.article_body: The Karnataka High Court (HC) has directed the state government and Election Commission to put on hold the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) new ward reservation list for elections till August 16. The court direction came after hearing petitions that claimed flaws in the reservation list. The court on August 16 will decide whether an interim stay is required.

132.title: My 40-45 days spent on shooting are equal to 65-70 days: Akshay Kumar
132.article_body: Following recent claims that he lacks commitment after the failure of 'Samrat Prithviraj', actor Akshay Kumar said, "My 40-45 days [spent on shooting are] equivalent to 65-70 days." "I take the same time to finish...as others take...but I've divided it in the best way," added Akshay. "My eight hours are equal to 14-15 hours of any other star," he'd stated.

133.title: ED summons 8 West Bengal IPS officers in coal smuggling case
133.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned eight IPS officers of West Bengal to New Delhi for questioning in the coal smuggling case. These officers were reportedly deputed in the area where illegal coal mining and smuggling were occurring and they were aware of the racket. Earlier today, CBI arrested senior Trinamool Congress leader Anubrata Mondal in a cattle smuggling case.

134.title: Washington Sundar suffers shoulder injury ahead of Zimbabwe tour
134.article_body: India all-rounder Washington Sundar, who has been named in India's squad for Zimbabwe ODIs, injured his shoulder during Lancashire's Royal London One-Day Championship encounter against Worcestershire on Wednesday. "Sundar left the field after receiving treatment on his left shoulder following a heavy landing," Lancashire tweeted. Sundar hasn't played for India since his hand injury in IPL 2022.

135.title: Mumbai businessman cheated of ₹22 lakh in sim swapping fraud
135.article_body: A 47-year old Mumbai businessman was allegedly cheated of ₹22 lakh in a sim swapping scam, where fraudsters obtain a duplicate SIM of an individual after collecting their personal data. The businessman approached the cyber police and said his SIM card services were disconnected on August 4. After the services resumed, he found text messages for transactions worth ₹22 lakh.

136.title: Want to be professionally stable: Arjun on wedding plans with Malaika
136.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said he wants to be "professionally a little more stable" before getting married to girlfriend Malaika Arora. He said he wants to do work that will make him happy. "Because if I'm happy, I can make my partner happy, I can live a happy life," he added. Arjun was the latest guest on 'Koffee with Karan 7'.

137.title: Every now & then Telugu industry calls for strike, it's temporary: Vijay
137.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda opened up about the ongoing halt enforced on shoots in the Telugu film industry. "We have a system of unions there, every now and then they call for a strike for a few days," he said. Vijay added that the hold is temporary and shooting will resume in a week. Vijay will next be seen in 'Liger'.

138.title: 'Mass-termind' of entertainment: Karan Johar on Puri Jagannadh
138.article_body: Director Karan Johar has called Puri Jagannadh a 'mass-termind' of entertainment. The filmmaker said Puri has a "distinctive vision". "I'm still amazed at how he knits together such larger than life storylines so effortlessly," KJo tweeted. Karan is producing Puri Jagannadh's 'Liger', which stars Vijay Deverakonda and Ananya Panday.

139.title: Sonam Kapoor rates Bhumi, Kiara & Kriti as ‘underrated’ actresses
139.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor rated Bhumi Pednekar, Kiara Advani and Kriti Sanon as the "underrated" actresses of Bollywood. Sonam shared her thoughts during the latest episode of 'Koffee with Karan 7', which is hosted by Karan Johar. She was accompanied by actor Arjun Kapoor. Sonam also called Arjun's 'Ek Villain Returns' a "thirst trap" film.

140.title: CJI asks lawyers to wear masks in courtrooms amid rising COVID cases
140.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana on Thursday advised lawyers to wear masks in courtrooms. "Please wear a mask. The majority of our staff and colleagues are getting COVID-19. Judges are also getting it," CJI, while hearing a PIL on freebies, told the lawyers. "I tested negative for COVID-19," Solicitor General Tushar Mehta said.

141.title: Axar's exclusion surprising, he did what was asked: Parthiv on Asia Cup
141.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel said he's "surprised" about all-rounder Axar Patel not being picked in the squad for Asia Cup 2022. "He has delivered for the team whenever they wanted and did whatever was asked," added Parthiv. "Axar should've been picked as a backup for Ravindra Jadeja," he stated. India will face Pakistan in the tournament on August 28.

142.title: 3 SRK fans arrive in Mumbai, steal truck to return home; arrested
142.article_body: Three fans of Shah Rukh Khan arrived in Mumbai on Saturday to see the actor's bungalow in Bandra. After running out of money, they stole a truck in Bandra and were later arrested in Gujarat. They said they stole the truck to reach their homes, police said. One man was from Uttar Pradesh and the other two were from Haryana.

143.title: Can't beg people to play for WI: Head coach on players choosing leagues over country
143.article_body: Referring to several West Indian cricketers choosing T20 leagues over playing for their country, West Indies head coach Phil Simmons said, "It hurts. There's no other way to put it." He added, "But what can you do? I don't think that I should be begging people to play for their countries." He further remarked, "Life has changed."

144.title: China blocks India's bid at UN to sanction Pak terrorist behind Kandahar hijacking
144.article_body: China has blocked a move by India and the US to list Pakistan-based JeM leader Abdul Rauf Azhar as a global terrorist at the UN Security Council. Azhar is accused of being involved in the 1999 hijacking of an Indian Airlines aircraft in Kandahar, the 2001 attack on the Parliament and the 2016 attack on the IAF base in Pathankot.

145.title: 'Undemocratic, authoritarian': Cong leader on Lal Singh Chaddha boycott
145.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Thursday said that claims to boycott Aamir Khan's 'Lal Singh Chaddha' present an undemocratic and authoritarian ideology. "I believe #BoycottLalSinghChadha is trending. Why? Who is behind this? Who else but the ModiShah Troll Army! They are undemocratic, authoritarian and dictatorial. Working like a Robot," Singh tweeted.

146.title: 10 shops washed way in river after cloudburst in Himachal's Kullu; video surfaces
146.article_body: A cloudburst has been reported from the Kullu region of Himachal Pradesh on Thursday. A video showing 10 shops and vehicles being washed away in a river in Anni tehsil has surfaced online. Notably, two women were also buried alive under debris after their house collapsed in a landslide in the Kullu district on Thursday, officials said.

147.title: I was a brown face in vanilla line-up: Taylor on facing racist comments by NZ teammates
147.article_body: Ex-New Zealand batter Ross Taylor revealed in his book he was subjected to racially insensitive comments by New Zealand teammates. "Cricket in New Zealand is a pretty white sport...For much of my career I've been an anomaly...a brown face in...vanilla line-up," he said. "A teammate used to tell me 'You're half a good guy'," Taylor stated.

148.title: Rajasthan bans animal fairs after over 12,000 cattle die of lumpy skin disease
148.article_body: Rajasthan government has banned animal fairs after over 12,000 cattle deaths due to the lumpy skin disease were reported in the state. According to a report, 2,511 deaths have been reported in Sri Ganganagar followed by 1,619 in Barmer, 1,581 in Jodhpur and 1,156 in Bikaner. A total of 2,81,484 animals are reportedly affected due to the disease.

149.title: Man's relatives chop off fiancé's father's nose for calling off engagement
149.article_body: The relatives of a man in Rajasthan's Barmer allegedly chopped off the nose of his fiancé's father for breaking off their engagement. The victim, Kamal Singh Bhati, told police that he had fixed his daughter's engagement in the same family where his niece was married. However, following his niece's murder, allegedly by her in-laws, he called off his daughter's engagement.

150.title: Economy losing money, freebies distribution a 'serious issue': SC
150.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday observed that the promise and distribution of freebies by political parties during the poll season is "a serious issue", as the economy is losing money because of this. Chief Justice of India NV Ramana said that there's poverty in India, adding that the welfare of the people has to be balanced.

151.title: Singer Arjun Kanungo shares pics from his wedding to South African model Carla Dennis
151.article_body: Singer Arjun Kanungo took to Instagram to share pictures from his wedding to South African model Carla Dennis. "My words cannot express how much love we received and how special the day was for us," he wrote in the caption. The couple had reportedly been dating for more than seven years.

152.title: Film that started it all, turns 21 today: Farhan on 'Dil Chahta...'
152.article_body: Filmmaker-actor Farhan Akhtar took to Instagram after his film 'Dil Chahta Hai' completed 21 years of its release on Wednesday. "The film that started it all, turns 21 today...Thank you to the audiences who continue to give it so much love," he wrote. Farhan made his directorial debut with the film. It featured Aamir Khan and Akshaye Khanna.

153.title: Kohli desperately needed runs but backed India's new approach: Manjrekar
153.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said Virat Kohli deserves credit for backing Team India's new aggressive approach during the recent T20Is against England despite being in desperate need of runs. "He did not care about whether he was...getting out," added Manjrekar. Discussing Team India's aggressive approach, Manjrekar stated that it comes more naturally to KL Rahul than Kohli.

154.title: Ukraine's Azov fighters to go on trial by summer end: Russia-backed official
154.article_body: Top Russia-backed official in Donetsk said on Wednesday that trial of captured Ukrainian fighters of Azov Regiment is likely to take place by the end of the summer in Mariupol. After fighting for weeks, Azov fighters surrendered to Russian forces in May. Russia's Supreme Court labeled the regiment as a terrorist organisation, clearing way for fighters to be charged formally.

155.title: Sanju behind in race for T20 WC spot, Hooda is definitely going: Aakash
155.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said Sanju Samson is "slightly behind" in the race for a spot in India's squad for the upcoming T20 WC. Aakash, however, said that all-rounder Deepak Hooda is a certain pick in the squad. "Hooda the hurricane, this boy is running ahead, this boy is not going to stop because he is definitely going," stated Aakash.

156.title: Snack centre in Pune looted over Dahi Handi contribution, 4 arrested
156.article_body: The Pune police on Thursday booked 10 persons for allegedly attacking and looting a snacks centre at Rahatani after an argument over financial contribution for the Dahi Handi festival celebration. Rahul Gupta, who runs Raj snacks and sweet centre, complained to the police stating the accused took nearly ₹10,000 from the shop. Police said they've arrested four of the accused.

157.title: 266 kg marijuana worth ₹66.5 lakh seized in Mumbai, 2 arrested
157.article_body: The Mumbai Police anti-narcotics cell (ANC) on Tuesday arrested two persons for allegedly transporting over 266 kg of marijuana worth ₹66.5 lakh. The accused were identified as Ashwin Kumar and Raju Lohar. "The team was waiting at the spot when two luxury cars were spotted...On searching, police found several bags of marijuana hidden under the seats," an ANC official said.

158.title: Tansa dam near Mumbai illuminated with Tricolour lights; video emerges
158.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has illuminated Tansa dam with Tricolour lights ahead of Independence Day. The dam, located near Mumbai, supplies drinking water to the people of the city. BMC said that the dam has been "creatively illuminated" as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. The civic body also shared a video of the illuminated dam on social media.

159.title: Google opposes Facebook-backed proposal for self-regulatory body: Report
159.article_body: Google has reservations about a Facebook, Twitter-backed proposal for developing a self-regulatory body for India's social media sector, Reuters reported. An executive from Google-parent Alphabet reportedly said the company was unconvinced about the body's merits. The body would mean external reviews of decisions that could force Google to reinstate content, the executive reportedly said.

160.title: ICICI Bank briefly hits ₹6 lakh cr m-cap for 1st time; 7th Indian firm to do so
160.article_body: ICICI Bank on Thursday briefly recorded market capitalisation (m-cap) of ₹6.01 lakh crore with its shares hitting a record high of ₹866.15 on BSE. The bank has now become the seventh Indian firm to cross the ₹6-trillion-mark in m-cap. So far, Reliance Industries, Tata Consultancy Services, HDFC Bank, Infosys, Hindustan Unilever and Life Insurance Corporation have hit this achievement.

161.title: I've got used to trolls and hate comments: Priya Prakash Varrier
161.article_body: Actress Priya Prakash Varrier revealed she was a victim of trolls, memes and hate comments after a clip of her winking in the film 'Oru Adaar Love' had gone viral on social media. Speaking about dealing with it, she said, "It's...been tough for me initially but over time, I got used to trolls...hate comments and learnt to ignore unnecessary things."

162.title: Sehwag trolls Pak conspiracy theorist Zaid for mistaking Neeraj Chopra with Ashish Nehra
162.article_body: Virender Sehwag trolled Pakistani conspiracy theorist Zaid Hamid for mistaking Neeraj Chopra with Ashish Nehra. In a tweet praising Arshad Nadeem for winning gold at CWG, Zaid claimed Nadeem beat Nehra. "Chicha...Nehra is right now preparing for UK PM elections...So Chill," Sehwag wrote. "Neeraj (or as per him Nehra) participated at CWG. This is latest news!" a user tweeted.

163.title: Daughters of PMO workers tie rakhi to PM Modi, video surfaces
163.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated Rakshabandhan with the daughters of PMO workers at his residence in Delhi. In a video shared by the PMO, the young girls are seen tying rakhi to PM Modi, some are also seen seeking his blessings after touching his feet. They are the daughters of the sweepers, peons, gardeners and drivers employed at the PMO.

164.title: US regulators deny broadband subsidies to SpaceX's Starlink, LTD
164.article_body: The US Federal Communications Commission (FCC) rejected Elon Musk-run SpaceX's Starlink and LTD Broadband's applications to receive more than $2 billion in internet service subsidies through a rural fund, the FCC said on Wednesday. The FCC further said that both Starlink and LTD Broadband gave inadequate answers to questions and are not capable of complying with commission requirements.

165.title: Akshay & I have a unique tuning to deliver meaningful films: Bhumi
165.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has said that actor Akshay Kumar has been a huge part of her acting career. "We have a unique tuning to deliver some meaningful films," she said. Speaking of 'Toilet: Ek Prem Katha' and 'Raksha Bandhan', Bhumi said that both the films can be watched with the family and deliver a message.

166.title: Go Fashion plans to open 120-130 stores every year
166.article_body: Go Fashion, the owner of women’s clothing brand Go Colors, reported a profit after tax (PAT) of ₹24.4 crore for the quarter ended June. It also said that it was working on expanding the brand across geographies by adding about 120-130 stores every year. Its total revenue surged to ₹165.2 crore from ₹31 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal.

167.title: Suspected militants attack jail in DR Congo, free over 800 prisoners
167.article_body: More than 800 prisoners have escaped after armed men attacked a prison in eastern DR Congo, authorities said on Wednesday. Fighters of the Allied Democratic Forces, a group linked to the Islamic State group, are being blamed for the jailbreak. Two police officers and a civilian were killed and part of the facility was damaged by a fire during attack.

168.title: Zerodha's Kite app faces technical snag in early trade
168.article_body: Stockbroking platform Zerodha’s mobile app Kite faced a technical snag as the markets opened on Thursday morning with several users taking to social media to complain about the same even as #zerodhadown trended on Twitter. The company shared an update at 9:21 am on its website to inform that the issue with its Kite mobile app had been resolved.

169.title: Just a phase: Maha minister on Nitish forming govt with RJD-led Grand Alliance
169.article_body: Maharashtra minister and Shiv Sena rebel camp leader Deepak Kesarkar has said that JD(U)'s alliance with the RJD-led Grand Alliance is "just a phase". He added, "JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar may reconsider his decision if he feels that he has picked the wrong party. That's not unprecedented." Nitish took oath as Bihar CM for the eighth time on Wednesday.

170.title: Noida-based startup SquadStack raises $17.5 mn in Series B round
170.article_body: Sales acceleration startup SquadStack has secured $17.5 million in a series B funding round led by Bertelsmann India Investments. The funding round saw participation of existing investors Chiratae Ventures and Blume Ventures. The Noida-based startup which was established in 2017, aims to use funds to hire more employees and increase its sales experts base.

171.title: Gurugram club manager, 6 bouncers arrested for beating up guests
171.article_body: At least six bouncers and the manager of Gurugram's club Casa Danza in Udyog Vihar have been arrested, police said. This comes after the accused allegedly beat up a manager of a multinational company and his friends for opposing the alleged molestation of their female friend. An argument had broken out between the bodyguards and the men, police added.

172.title: Several Chinese cities expand fresh restrictions amid COVID outbreak
172.article_body: Several Chinese cities imposed fresh restrictions and lockdowns to contain COVID-19 outbreak. Authorities in the manufacturing hub Yiwu, home to 1.9 million people, have announced three days of "silent management" in which some residents are confined to their homes and most are banned from leaving designated areas. People can step out for COVID-19 tests, grocery shopping and hospital visits.

173.title: What a joke, I had no desire of becoming VP: Nitish Kumar
173.article_body: Refuting the claim that he wanted to become country's Vice President, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, "You heard a man say…I wanted to be the Vice President. What a joke! It's bogus. I had no such desire." On Wednesday, BJP's Sushil Kumar Modi alleged Kumar dumped NDA as his ambition of becoming country's Vice President couldn’t be accommodated by BJP.

174.title: She'll win gold in 2024 Olympics: Telangana Sports Minister on Sreeja
174.article_body: Telangana Sports Minister V Srinivas Goud said Sreeja Akula, who alongside Sharath Kamal helped India win its first-ever table tennis mixed doubles gold at CWG, during CWG 2022, will win gold in the 2024 Paris Olympics. "We went into the mixed doubles competition without enough practice sessions because of the tight schedule," Sreeja had said after the mixed doubles gold.

175.title: Hindu family saves Muharram procession from fire near slain Kanhaiya Lal's shop in Udaipur
