The woman, Sudha V, has sought police assistance over the issue. Sudha stated that she was stopped by the Parent Teacher Association as she hails from the SC community.

349.title: Apple supplier Foxconn reports 12% profit in June quarter
349.article_body: Apple's supplier Foxconn reported a 12% jump in second-quarter net profit, aided by strong demand for its cloud computing products. The Taiwan-based company said that net profit for the April-June quarter rose to T$33.29 billion from T$29.78 billion a year ago. Experts have warned that Apple should brace for softer demand in China as COVID-19 lockdowns have affected the economy.

350.title: Nitish Kumar will never be PM, chair reserved for PM Modi: Nityanand Rai
350.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will "never be the Prime Minister" as the post is "reserved" for PM Narendra Modi, Union Minister Nityanand Rai said while addressing speculations about Kumar's national ambitions. "[Kumar's] move has proved that he does everything only for power," Rai said. "The people of...the entire country...[have] blessed Narendra Modi to be the PM for lifetime," he added.

351.title: Speeding car runs over Class 12 student in Gurugram: Police
351.article_body: Gurugram Police on Tuesday said that a Class 12 student died and his classmate was injured when a speeding car hit their scooty in the Farrukhnagar area on Monday. The car driver managed to flee, leaving his vehicle behind, the police added. The accident occurred when the students were returning home from school.

352.title: India could be Asia's strongest economy in 2022-23: Morgan Stanley
352.article_body: India could emerge as Asia's strongest economy in 2022-2023 with an expected average growth of 7%, Morgan Stanley economists said. The brokerage expects the country to contribute 28% and 22% to Asian and global growth, respectively. Buoyed by business investments, economic policy reforms and a young workforce, India is in a good position to generate robust domestic demand, it said.

353.title: Agritech startup Produze raises $2.6 million in seed funding
353.article_body: Agritech startup Produze secured $2.6 million in a seed funding round led by venture capital firms Accel and All In Capital. The startup's Co-founder and CEO Ben Mathew told Moneycontrol that the funds will be used to expand procurement sources and strengthen the tech team. Produze is a business-to-business (B2B) platform that aims to connect farm producers and international retailers.

354.title: SC clubs and transfers all FIRs filed against Nupur Sharma to Delhi Police
354.article_body: The Supreme Court has clubbed and transferred all FIRs lodged in several states against suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma over her remarks on the Prophet Mohammad to Delhi Police, saying that it has taken note of the serious threat to her life. The court also added that till the probe is completed, protection from arrest to Sharma shall continue.

355.title: Such players are needed in the team: Kiran More on Hardik Pandya
355.article_body: Former India cricketer Kiran More has praised all-rounder Hardik Pandya for the way the 28-year-old has made his comeback to the team. More stated that players who can "bowl four overs, take wickets [and] get runs for the team" are needed in the playing XI. Hardik is part of India's squad for the upcoming Asia Cup.

356.title: BJP, Cong speak against each other & leave, never talk about welfare: Kejriwal
356.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday in Gujarat said that BJP and Congress come, speak against each other and leave. "[They] never talk about the welfare of people. We take up issues of electricity and employment," Kejriwal added. "We made electricity free in Delhi, Punjab...will do same in three months of being elected here," he stated.

357.title: More work needs to be done to reset China-Aus ties: Chinese envoy
357.article_body: The Chinese Ambassador to Australia, Xiao Qian, on Wednesday said that more work needs to be done to reset relations between China and Australia. The two nations had not yet reached the stage of resolving political and trade disputes, he added. Notably, leaders of the two countries have not met in recent years.

358.title: TV actors Dheeraj Dhoopar, Vinny Arora blessed with a baby boy
358.article_body: 'Kundali Bhagya' actor Dheeraj Dhoopar and his wife, actress Vinny Arora have been blessed with their first child, a baby boy. The duo took to Instagram to share the news. The couple had announced the pregnancy in April this year. Several actors including Jay Bhanushali, Divyanka Tripathi Dahiya, Shiny Doshi and Tina Datta congratulated the couple in the comments section.

359.title: My heart swells with pride when I see you lead Vedanta: Anil Agarwal on daughter's b'day
359.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal on Wednesday wrote a note for his daughter Priya Agarwal Hebbar on her birthday. He wrote, "My heart swells with pride when I watch you lead Vedanta with dedication and passion…It is such a joy to see you give your all into everything you do". Priya is currently the Director at Vedanta Resources.

360.title: Has power to burrow into minds and hearts: Twinkle on 'Raksha...'
360.article_body: Twinkle Khanna said 'Raksha Bandhan' is a film "about the India we all pretend doesn't exist". The former actress shared a note in which she said the Akshay Kumar film has the "power to burrow into the minds and hearts of people across the board". She said the film will leave the audience teary-eyed. 'Raksha Bandhan' also stars Bhumi Pednekar.

361.title: Trishala's b'day always 'one of the greatest moments of my life': Sanjay
361.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt posted a throwback photo of his daughter Trishala Dutt to wish her on her 34th birthday. Sharing the picture, which also featured him, Sanjay wrote that her birthday "will always be one of the greatest moments of my life". He continued, "Nothing lights up my world like you @trishaladutt! Happy Birthday my princess, Papa Dukes loves you."

362.title: Tried dismissing Sehwag with short ball, it went over stadium for six: Lee
362.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said the Australian team would try to bowl a short ball to Virender Sehwag, to encourage him to hit the ball down to third man. "We tried it in an ODI, I bowled...[a] short [ball] and thought he'll...fall for the trap...It went over the stadium for six," added Lee. "He'd give...[a] cheeky little wink," stated Lee.

363.title: Shameful over Partha’s case but we aren’t cut from same cloth: TMC leader
363.article_body: TMC leader Firhad Hakim on Wednesday said, "We feel shame over the Partha Chatterjee case." Furthermore, he said, "It doesn't mean that we are all cut from the same cloth. We did not devote much of our lives to public service only to be defamed as corrupt people." Ex-Bengal minister Chatterjee was arrested in alleged job scam case.

364.title: Gaming startup Lysto raises $12 mn in pre-Series A funding round
364.article_body: Singapore and Bengaluru-based gaming startup Lysto has raised $12 million in a pre-Series A funding round. The funding round saw participation from investors such as Square Peg, BEENEXT, Hashed, Tiger Global, and Better Capital, and some angel investors. Lysto was founded in 2021 by Sadiq Ahamed, and builds APIs, NFTs and allied tools for online gamers.

365.title: Mumbai Police waits 4 days to get confession from arrested intoxicated thief
365.article_body: A 22-year-old man was arrested for allegedly burgling a house in Mumbai's Trombay, but the police had to wait for four days to interrogate him, as he was intoxicated at the time of his arrest. However, the police were able to recover the stolen valuables worth almost ₹2 lakh. The accused committed the crime because of unemployment, an official said.

366.title: Telangana govt approves funding for road improvements in Hyderabad
366.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits has been sanctioned funds by the Telangana government to make improvements to the roads in the city. Local leaders and residents have appreciated the step. Anil Kumar, a local leader from the Nampally area, thanked the Telangana government and Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao, and said that development works have made residents happy.

367.title: Former Twitter employee convicted of spying for Saudi Arabia
367.article_body: Ahmad Abouammo, a Lebanese-US national and a former Twitter employee, has been convicted of spying for the Saudi Arabian government. After a two-and-a-half-week trial, Abouammo was found guilty of six charges including money laundering, fraud and acting as an illegal agent for a foreign government. FBI said that Abouammo used his position to access confidential user data.

368.title: Tabu gets injured while driving truck in jungle during film shoot: Reports
368.article_body: Actress Tabu got injured while driving a truck in a jungle in Hyderabad during the shoot of Ajay Devgn directorial 'Bholaa', reports said. A bike chasing the truck collided with it, following which a piece of shredded glass flew and cut Tabu just above her right eye, reports added. The shoot was then briefly halted, reports further stated.

369.title: Delhi airport's 4th runway to be operational by early 2023: AAI
369.article_body: The fourth runway at Delhi’s Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport is set to get operational by early 2023 with the completion of instrument landing system installation and other works such as painting runway markings and calibration by December, the Airports Authority of India (AAI) said. With this, IGI airport will become the only Indian airport to have four runways.

370.title: Godavari crosses first danger mark in Andhra for second month in a row
370.article_body: Godavari river crossed the first danger mark at Sir Arthur Cotton Barrage at Dowlaiswaram in Andhra Pradesh for the second month in a row on Wednesday. State Disaster Management Authority MD BR Ambedkar on Wednesday morning said Godavari's inflow stood at 10.27 lakh cusecs. Officials of districts along the river have accordingly been alerted to take precautionary measures, Ambedkar said.

371.title: UK plans blackouts in Jan as part of emergency energy plan: Report
371.article_body: Under the government's ''reasonable worst-case scenario'', UK could face an electricity shortfall leading to four-day organised blackouts for households and industries in January, a Bloomberg report said. This is because of reduced energy imports from Norway and France. However, the Department of Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy said the scenario is ''not something we expect to happen''.

372.title: Homeless man carrying knife at Paris airport shot dead by police
372.article_body: Police officers on Wednesday shot dead a knife-wielding man at Paris' Charles de Gaulle International airport. The man, who was reportedly homeless, brandished a knife at the officials after cursing at them near one of the airport's terminals. He was reportedly shot at after refusing to put down the knife despite repeated requests by the authorities.

373.title: Drug firm Pfizer's MD S Sridhar resigns to take early retirement
373.article_body: Drug firm Pfizer on Wednesday said its Managing Director S Sridhar has resigned from the company as he intended to take early retirement. Sridhar has held several key positions in the company over the past 14 years. He was the MD for the past six years and would continue in the role until his replacement is selected, Pfizer said.

374.title: Cloud kitchen startup BigSpoon raises ₹100 cr in Series A funding
374.article_body: Ahmedabad-based cloud kitchen startup BigSpoon has secured ₹100 crore in Series A funding round which saw participation of Bollywood actor and investor Mouni Roy. IAN, NB Ventures, Go Ventures, LetsVenture, Grip Invest and Anicut Capital also participated in the round. The firm said it will use funds to hire people for leadership roles and invest in technology for clients.

375.title: We'll give bumper jobs in 1 month, it'll be so grand it's never happened before: Tejashwi
375.article_body: After taking oath as Bihar Deputy CM on Wednesday, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav said that the state government will give "bumper" jobs to the poor and youth within one month. "It will be something so grand that it's never happened before," he added. "Bihar did what the country needs to do," Tejashwi further said.

376.title: My family being harassed at behest of BJP MP Sharma: Shrikant Tyagi's wife
376.article_body: Anu Tyagi, wife of self-claimed BJP leader Shrikant Tyagi, on Wednesday said that her family was being harassed at the behest of BJP MP Mahesh Sharma. When asked about Mahesh Sharma's denial that Shrikant Tyagi was a BJP member, she said, "My husband was a BJP member. I was not tortured physically, but I was harassed mentally," she said.

377.title: Sisodia demands CBI inquiry into alleged ₹6,000 cr toll tax scam in MCD
377.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has written to Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena demanding a CBI inquiry into the alleged toll tax scam worth ₹6,000 crore in the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD). This comes after AAP MLA Durgesh Pathak on Tuesday claimed that tax is collected from around 10 lakh commercial vehicles daily but it does not reach MCD.

378.title: 'Get well soon' wishes pour in as Raju Srivastava suffers heart attack
378.article_body: 'Get well soon' messages and health wishes poured in for comedian Raju Srivastava on Twitter after he suffered a heart attack while working out at a gym in Delhi on Wednesday. Comedian Sunil Pal shared a video stating Raju is out of danger and said, "Get well soon bhai...Stay healthy." News anchor Shantanu Kumar tweeted, "Wishing you a speedy recovery."

379.title: Coinbase reports $1.1 billion net loss in Q2, revenue drops 60%
379.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase reported operating loss of $1.04 billion in second quarter compared to $874.7 million operating profit in the corresponding period last year, leading to its stock to close 10.5% lower on Tuesday. Its revenue fell around 60% from year-ago period. "Dramatic market movements shifted user behaviour and trading volume, which impacted transaction revenue," company said.

380.title: Rahul's inclusion in squad for Asia Cup shows how valuable he is: Styris
380.article_body: Ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris has said KL Rahul's inclusion in India's squad for the Asia Cup and being named the vice-captain shows how valuable he is to the team. "Rahul was always the frontline player in this Indian side...I guess it's unlucky for Ishan Kishan," added Styris. Rahul hasn't played any competitive cricket since IPL 2022.

381.title: JSW Energy unit to buy Mytrah Energy's renewable assets for ₹10,530 cr
381.article_body: JSW Energy’s wholly owned subsidiary, JSW Neo Energy, on Wednesday said that it has agreed to acquire a portfolio of 1,753 MW of renewable energy generation capacity from Mytrah Energy (India) for ₹10,530 crore. This is JSW Energy’s largest acquisition since its inception and will help achieve its renewable-led capacity growth target by FY25, well ahead of timelines, it said.

382.title: Hindalco's Q1 net profit surges 48% to ₹4,119 cr, revenue up 40%
382.article_body: Hindalco Industries Limited on Wednesday reported a 48% surge in consolidated net profit to ₹4,119 crore in the quarter ended June as against ₹2,787 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Its consolidated revenue also rose 40% year-on-year to ₹58,018 crore compared to ₹41,358 crore. The company's shares closed 4.41% higher at ₹440.05 on the BSE.

383.title: You are such a strong woman: Caitlyn on Khloe welcoming 2nd child
383.article_body: Caitlyn Jenner took to Twitter to congratulate Khloe Kardashian after she welcomed her second child on Friday. Jenner tweeted, "I love you so much! You are such a strong woman. And what an amazing mother!" Khloe had her second baby with Tristan Thompson despite their break-up. Khloe welcomed the child via surrogate.

384.title: How did I let that happen?: Amanda Seyfried on filming nude scenes at 19
384.article_body: Talking about filming nude scenes at 19, actress Amanda Seyfried, who starred in 'Mean Girls' said, "Being 19, walking around without my underwear on, like, are you kidding me? How did I let that happen?" "I was 19...I did not want to upset anybody and I wanted to keep my job. That is why," added Seyfried.

385.title: Nitish Kumar countered era of backdoor politics very well: TRS MLC
385.article_body: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Bihar, TRS MLC K Kavitha said that it’s a positive change for the whole nation. "The era of backdoor politics has been countered very well by Nitish Kumar," Kavitha added. "I appreciate the efforts he has taken and 'Mahagathbandhan' which stood behind him to uphold the verdict given by people of Bihar," Kavitha stated.

386.title: BJP finishes off its allies, Nitish Kumar made a wise decision: Pawar
386.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday accused BJP of finishing off its regional allies gradually and supported Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's decision to sever ties with the party. "He took the decision, anticipating the crisis the BJP was planning to bring on. I think he took a wise decision for his state and party," Pawar said.

387.title: Nitish Kumar will take advantage of Lalu's illness to try & split RJD: BJP
387.article_body: BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi on Wednesday said that Nitish Kumar will cause a split in RJD by taking advantage of Lalu Prasad Yadav's illness. "We would like to see how the new Bihar government functions with Tejashwi as de facto CM; it will fall before the next polls," the BJP leader said.

388.title: BJP can say anything, whether I stay till 2024 or not, I'll not stay in 2014: Nitish
388.article_body: After taking oath as Bihar CM, Nitish Kumar told journalists that BJP can say what they want. He said, "Whether I stay till 2024 or not, but I will not stay in 2014." He also said, "Those who came to power in 2014, will they be victorious in 2024?", adding that he wants the Opposition to be united for 2024.

389.title: Restore senior citizen rebate in sleeper, AC 3-tier: Parliamentary panel
389.article_body: A Parliamentary panel has urged the Ministry of Railways to review and "urgently" restore the rebate given to senior citizens at least for sleeper and AC 3-tier classes. Senior citizens were earlier given concessions amounting to 40-50% of their railway fares. The government had earlier withdrawn the concessions in view of the COVID-19 pandemic.

390.title: I don't care about what people are saying: Shubman Gill on his strike rate
390.article_body: India opener Shubman Gill has said he doesn't care about what people are saying over his strike rate in white-ball cricket. "I feel questions will always be raised, but I don't care...as long as I'm doing what my team management and my captain expect of me." Shubman scored 64(53), 43(49) and 98*(98) in the three-match ODI series against West Indies.

391.title: Mumbai man forcefully tries to open metro platform door; trains detained
391.article_body: A man forcefully tried to open the platform screen door at Mumbai's Dahisar East metro station on Sunday. His actions triggered the alarm on the door, which automatically stopped all trains from entering the station. Metro officials reportedly fixed the problem within two minutes. The man's actions were caught on a CCTV camera.

392.title: Pakistani woman attempts to cross border for Hyderabadi lover; arrested
392.article_body: A Pakistani woman was arrested along with two aides at the India-Nepal border for allegedly trying to cross into India illegally. The accused, Kalija Noor from Faisalabad in Pakistan, fell in love with a Hyderabad-based man Ahmed, whom she met online. Ahmed arranged for Noor to enter India, but she was caught carrying fabricated documents by the border security agency.

393.title: 'Laal…' stars Aamir, Mona Singh seek blessings at Golden Temple, pic surfaces
393.article_body: Bollywood actor Aamir Khan on Wednesday visited the Golden Temple in Amritsar to seek blessings for his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. The actor was accompanied by actress Mona Singh, who plays his mother in the Advait Chandan directorial. Earlier this week, Aamir paid tribute to war heroes at the National War Memorial in Delhi.

394.title: Rarely emotional but got carried away: Akshay on crying after sister's message
394.article_body: Having been left in tears after listening to his sister's message on a reality show, actor Akshay Kumar said, "I rarely get emotional during a show. But when I saw the video...I got carried away." "We used to live in a small house. After the arrival of this goddess, our lives changed," Akshay had earlier stated, referring to his sister.

395.title: Murder of democracy: Shiv Sena on Maharashtra govt expansion in Saamana
395.article_body: The Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' criticised the coalition between the party's Eknath Shinde camp and BJP, a day after the Maharashtra government expanded the cabinet. "It is the murder of democracy and the Constitution to administer oath to some of the legislators whose disqualification petitions are being heard by the Supreme Court," the editorial said.

396.title: Hope political stability returns to Bihar now: Prashant Kishor
396.article_body: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Bihar, poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Wednesday said this era of political instability has been ongoing for past 10 years. "I hope political stability returns to Bihar now. Nitish Kumar has said that he is starting a new chapter," Kishor added. "I hope he fulfils the aspirations of the people of Bihar," Kishor stated.

397.title: Shortcomings in security at 3 railway stations, shopping centres: Delhi Police
397.article_body: Delhi Police has said that security protocols are not being followed at the New Delhi, Shivaji Bridge and Tughlakabad railway stations and at markets in Vasant Lok, South Extension II and Nehru Place. "Several shortcomings have been noticed in various hotels...taxi stands...cinemas and malls," DCP IP Singh said. The police found that some hotels don't even have a valid licence.

398.title: Shilpa Shetty breaks her leg while shooting, shares pic
398.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram to share a picture of herself sitting in a wheelchair after breaking her leg during a shoot. She wrote, "They said, 'Roll camera action - break a leg!' I took it literally...Out of action for 6 weeks...but I'll be back soon stronger and better." She added, "Till then, dua mein yaad rakhiyega...Prayers always work."

399.title: Important for me to voice my opinion: Ananya on her remarks on 'Arjun Reddy'
399.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday opened up about her comments on Vijay Deverakonda's 'Arjun Reddy' on 'Koffee with Karan 7'. "It's important for me to voice my opinion and speak up about topics I feel strongly about," Ananya said. In the show, Ananya had said she wouldn't be fine with someone like the male lead in 'Arjun Reddy'.

400.title: It is the most relatable film I’ve made: Aanand on 'Raksha Bandhan'
400.article_body: Director Aanand L Rai, speaking about his upcoming film 'Raksha Bandhan', has said that it is the most relatable film he has made. "I don't know how much it will be liked...I do know that nobody can dislike it. 'Raksha Bandhan' cannot fail to touch the hearts of every Indian," he added. The film features Akshay Kumar and Bhumi Pednekar.

401.title: Tejashwi is the real CM of Bihar, Nitish just for show: BJP's Sushil Modi
401.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi said that in the new 'Mahagathbandhan' government in Bihar, Nitish Kumar will be CM just for show and the real CM will be Tejashwi Yadav. "[RJD] have a strength of 80, [JDU] have 45-46. Everyone knows how Lalu Yadav works," he added. "The 2020 mandate was for PM Narendra Modi," he further said.

402.title: Tesla lobbying to set up 'advanced manufacturing facility' in Canada
402.article_body: Tesla is lobbying the Canadian government to set up an "advanced manufacturing facility", a filing by the firm showed. Tesla is working with the government to "identify opportunities for industrial facility permitting reforms", the amended filing from July 18 said. Tesla CEO Elon Musk said last week the company "might be able" to announce a new factory later this year.
